glsa.title: Pan: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability in Pan may allow remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Pan is a newsreader for the GNOME desktop.

description.p: Pavel Polischouk reported a boundary error in the PartsBatch class when processing .nzb files.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted .nzb file, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Pan users should upgrade to the latest version:
